Volume on computer literacy

Computer literacy is a volume of notes on how to do small, practical tasks on the computer, in context of studying, researching, and publishing scientific content.

Bash

Bash is a command line interface, a shell, between the user and the computer kernel.

Open the chapter on bash

SFTP: Secure File Transfer Protocol

Secure file transfer protocol (SFTP) is a method of transfering files securely between a local and a remote host computer.

Open the chapter on sftp

Git

Git is a free and open source distributed version control system designed to handle everything from small to very large projects with speed and efficiency.

Open the chapter on git

Markdown

Markdown is a lightweight markup language with plain-text-formatting syntax. ... Markdown is often used to format readme files, for writing messages in online discussion forums, and to create rich text using a plain text editor.

Open the chapter on markdown

R and RMarkdown

R is an open source language and environment for statistical computing and graphics. ... RMarkdown allows the creation of documents that serve as a neat record of statistical analysis, including the R script used to analyse data, the outputs, and human readable notes using Markdown syntax.

Open the chapter on R and RMarkdown

Python

Python is an interpreted, object-oriented, high-level programming language with dynamic semantics. ... Python's simple, easy to learn syntax emphasizes readability and therefore reduces the cost of program maintenance. Python supports modules and packages, which encourages program modularity and code reuse.

Open the chapter on Python
